query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Come l’augello, intra l’amate fronde, 2 posato al nido de’ suoi dolci nati 3 la notte che le cose ci nasconde,
4 che, per veder li aspetti disïati 5 e per trovar lo cibo onde li pasca, 6 in che gravi labor li sono aggrati,
7 previene il tempo in su aperta frasca, 8 e con ardente affetto il sole aspetta, 9 fiso guardando pur che l’alba nasca;
10 così la donna mïa stava eretta 11 e attenta, rivolta inver’ la plaga 12 sotto la quale il sol mostra men fretta:
13 sì che, veggendola io sospesa e vaga, 14 fecimi qual è quei che disïando 15 altro vorria, e sperando s’appaga.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Like the bird, among the beloved leaves, 2 perched at the nest of its sweet offspring 3 on the night that hides things from us,
4 that, in order to see their desired faces 5 and to find the food with which to feed them, 6 in which difficult labors are pleasing to them,
7 anticipates the time on an open branch, 8 and with ardent affection awaits the sun, 9 intently watching for the dawn to break;
10 thus my lady stood erect 11 and attentive, turned towards the region 12 under which the sun shows less haste:
13 so that, seeing her suspended and eager, 14 I became like one who, desiring 15 something else, is satisfied by hoping.
**Malay:**
1 Seperti burung, di antara dedaunan yang dicintainya, 2 bertengger di sarang anak-anaknya yang manis 3 pada malam yang menyembunyikan segala sesuatu dari kita,
4 yang, untuk melihat wajah-wajah yang diinginkannya 5 dan untuk menemukan makanan untuk memberinya makan, 6 di mana kerja keras yang berat menyenangkan bagi mereka,
7 mendahului waktu di dahan yang terbuka, 8 dan dengan kasih sayang yang membara menunggu matahari, 9 dengan saksama memperhatikan fajar menyingsing;
10 demikianlah wanita milikku berdiri tegak 11 dan penuh perhatian, berbalik ke arah wilayah 12 di mana matahari menunjukkan lebih sedikit ketergesaan:
13 sehingga, melihatnya tergantung dan bersemangat, 14 aku menjadi seperti orang yang menginginkan 15 sesuatu yang lain, puas dengan harapan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Pariemi che ’l suo viso ardesse tutto, 23 e li occhi avea di letizia sì pieni, 24 che passarmen convien sanza costrutto.
query.result:
**English:**
22 It seemed to me that her face was all aflame, 23 and her eyes were so full of joy, 24 that I must pass on without explaining.
**Malay:**
22 Sepertinya wajahnya menyala-nyala, 23 dan matanya begitu penuh dengan kegembiraan, 24 sehingga aku harus meninggalkannya tanpa penjelasan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Quale ne’ plenilunïi sereni 26 Trivïa ride tra le ninfe etterne 27 che dipingon lo ciel per tutti i seni,
28 vid’ i’ sopra migliaia di lucerne 29 un sol che tutte quante l’accendea, 30 come fa ’l nostro le viste superne;
31 e per la viva luce trasparea 32 la lucente sustanza tanto chiara 33 nel viso mio, che non la sostenea.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Like in the full moons, serene, 26 Trivia rides among the eternal nymphs 27 that paint the sky with all the arts,
28 I saw above thousands of lamps 29 a sun that lit them all, 30 as ours does the supernal sights;
31 and through the living light shone 32 the shining substance so clear 33 in my face, that it could not bear it.
**Malay:**
25 Seperti di bulan purnama yang tenang, 26 Trivia menunggang kuda di antara para nimfa abadi 27 yang melukis langit dengan segala seni,
28 aku melihat di atas ribuan lampu 29 sebuah matahari yang menyalakan semuanya, 30 seperti matahari kita menyalakan pemandangan surgawi;
31 dan melalui cahaya yang hidup bersinar 32 substansi yang bersinar begitu jelas 33 di wajahku, sehingga aku tidak dapat menahannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Oh Bëatrice, dolce guida e cara! 35 Ella mi disse: «Quel che ti sobranza 36 è virtù da cui nulla si ripara.
query.result:
**English:**
34 Oh Beatrice, sweet and dear guide! 35 She said to me: "That which overwhelms you 36 is a virtue from which nothing can protect itself.
**Malay:**
34 Oh Beatrice, pemandu yang manis dan sayang! 35 Dia berkata kepadaku: "Apa yang membuatmu kewalahan 36 adalah kebajikan yang darinya tidak ada yang dapat melindungi diri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Quivi è la sapïenza e la possanza 38 ch’aprì le strade tra ’l cielo e la terra, 39 onde fu già sì lunga disïanza».
query.result:
**English:**
37 Here is the wisdom and the power 38 that opened the roads between heaven and earth, 39 where there was once such a long estrangement.
**Malay:**
37 Di sinilah kebijaksanaan dan kekuasaan 38 yang membuka jalan antara langit dan bumi, 39 yang dulunya terdapat keterasingan yang begitu panjang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Come foco di nube si diserra 41 per dilatarsi sì che non vi cape, 42 e fuor di sua natura in giù s’atterra,
43 la mente mia così, tra quelle dape 44 fatta più grande, di sé stessa uscìo, 45 e che si fesse rimembrar non sape.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Like a fire that is enclosed by a cloud 41 so that it can expand and no longer be contained, 42 and against its nature falls to the ground,
43 so my mind, among those foods 44 having grown larger, went beyond itself, 45 and how it did so it cannot recall.
**Malay:**
40 Seperti api yang tertutup oleh awan 41 untuk mengembang sehingga tidak dapat ditampung, 42 dan melawan kodratnya jatuh ke tanah,
43 pikiranku pun demikian, di antara makanan-makanan itu 44 menjadi lebih besar, melampaui dirinya sendiri, 45 dan bagaimana hal itu terjadi, ia tidak dapat mengingatnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 «Apri li occhi e riguarda qual son io; 47 tu hai vedute cose, che possente 48 se’ fatto a sostener lo riso mio».
query.result:
**English:**
46 "Open your eyes and see who I am; 47 you have seen things that have made you able 48 to endure my smile."
**Malay:**
46 "Bukalah matamu dan lihatlah siapa aku; 47 engkau telah melihat hal-hal yang membuatmu mampu 48 untuk menahan senyumanku."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Io era come quei che si risente 50 di visïone oblita e che s’ingegna 51 indarno di ridurlasi a la mente,
52 quand’ io udi’ questa proferta, degna 53 di tanto grato, che mai non si stingue 54 del libro che ’l preterito rassegna.
query.result:
**English:**
49 I was like one who rouses himself 50 from a forgotten vision and tries in vain 51 to bring it back to mind,
52 when I heard this offer, worthy 53 of such gratitude that it never fades 54 from the book that records the past.
**Malay:**
49 Aku seperti orang yang terbangun 50 dari penglihatan yang terlupakan dan berusaha dengan sia-sia 51 untuk mengingatnya kembali,
52 ketika aku mendengar tawaran ini, yang layak 53 untuk rasa terima kasih yang sebesar-besarnya, yang tidak pernah pudar 54 dari buku yang mencatat masa lalu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 Se mo sonasser tutte quelle lingue 56 che Polimnïa con le suore fero 57 del latte lor dolcissimo più pingue,
58 per aiutarmi, al millesmo del vero 59 non si verria, cantando il santo riso 60 e quanto il santo aspetto facea mero;
61 e così, figurando il paradiso, 62 convien saltar lo sacrato poema, 63 come chi trova suo cammin riciso.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Even if all those tongues were mine 56 that Polyhymnia and her sisters made 57 more copious with their sweetest milk,
58 to help me, not even a thousandth of the truth 59 would be reached, singing of the holy smile 60 and how much the holy aspect made pure;
61 and so, in depicting paradise, 62 the sacred poem must leap forward, 63 like one who finds his path cut off.
**Malay:**
55 Sekalipun semua bahasa itu milikku 56 yang diciptakan oleh Polyhymnia dan para saudaranya 57 dengan susu mereka yang paling manis dan paling banyak,
58 untuk membantuku, bahkan seperseribu dari kebenaran 59 tidak akan tercapai, dengan menyanyikan senyuman suci 60 dan betapa aspek suci itu menjadi murni;
61 dan dengan demikian, dalam menggambarkan surga, 62 puisi suci itu harus melompat maju, 63 seperti orang yang menemukan jalannya terputus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Ma chi pensasse il ponderoso tema 65 e l’omero mortal che se ne carca, 66 nol biasmerebbe se sott’ esso trema:
67 non è pareggio da picciola barca 68 quel che fendendo va l’ardita prora, 69 né da nocchier ch’a sé medesmo parca.
query.result:
**English:**
64 But whoever considers the weighty theme 65 and the mortal shoulder that bears it, 66 would not blame it if it trembles beneath it:
67 it is not a match for a small boat 68 that which the daring prow cleaves through, 69 nor for a helmsman who spares himself.
**Malay:**
64 Tetapi sesiapa yang memikirkan tema yang berat 65 dan bahu manusia yang memikulnya, 66 tidak akan menyalahkannya jika ia gemetar di bawahnya:
67 bukan tandingan bagi perahu kecil 68 apa yang dibelah oleh haluan yang berani, 69 atau bagi nakhoda yang mengampuni dirinya sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 «Perché la faccia mia sì t’innamora, 71 che tu non ti rivolgi al bel giardino 72 che sotto i raggi di Cristo s’infiora?
73 Quivi è la rosa in che ’l verbo divino 74 carne si fece; quivi son li gigli 75 al cui odor si prese il buon cammino».
query.result:
**English:**
70 "Why does my face so enamour you, 71 that you do not turn to the fair garden 72 that blossoms beneath the rays of Christ?
73 There is the rose in which the divine Word 74 became flesh; there are the lilies 75 whose fragrance led us to take the good path."
**Malay:**
70 "Mengapa wajahku begitu memikatmu, 71 sehingga kamu tidak berpaling ke taman yang indah 72 yang berbunga di bawah sinar Kristus?
73 Di sanalah bunga mawar tempat firman Tuhan 74 menjadi daging; di sanalah bunga lili 75 yang wanginya menuntun kita untuk mengambil jalan yang baik."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Così Beatrice; e io, che a’ suoi consigli 77 tutto era pronto, ancora mi rendei 78 a la battaglia de’ debili cigli.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Thus Beatrice; and I, who to her counsels 77 was all prepared, again surrendered 78 to the battle of the feeble eyes.
**Malay:**
76 Demikianlah Beatrice; dan aku, yang terhadap nasihat-nasihatnya 77 sudah sepenuhnya siap, sekali lagi menyerah 78 pada pertarungan mata yang lemah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 O benigna vertù che sì li ’mprenti, 86 sù t’essaltasti, per largirmi loco 87 a li occhi lì che non t’eran possenti.
query.result:
**English:**
85 O benign power that so inspires them, 86 rise up and exalt yourself, to grant me a place 87 with those eyes that could not see you.
**Malay:**
85 Wahai kuasa kebaikan yang begitu mengilhami mereka, 86 bangkitlah dan tinggikan dirimu, untuk memberiku tempat 87 bersama mata-mata yang tidak dapat melihatmu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Il nome del bel fior ch’io sempre invoco 89 e mane e sera, tutto mi ristrinse 90 l’animo ad avvisar lo maggior foco;
91 e come ambo le luci mi dipinse 92 il quale e il quanto de la viva stella 93 che là sù vince come qua giù vinse,
94 per entro il cielo scese una facella, 95 formata in cerchio a guisa di corona, 96 e cinsela e girossi intorno ad ella.
query.result:
**English:**
88 The name of the fair flower that I always invoke 89 morning and evening, wholly 90 turned my mind to contemplate the greater fire;
91 and as both my eyes depicted for me 92 the quality and quantity of the living star 93 that conquers up there as it conquered down here,
94 a torch descended through the sky, 95 formed in a circle like a crown, 96 and encircled and revolved around her.
**Malay:**
88 Nama bunga cantik yang selalu kupanggil 89 pagi dan petang, sepenuhnya 90 mengalihkan pikiranku untuk merenungkan api yang lebih besar;
91 dan ketika kedua mataku menggambarkan bagiku 92 kualitas dan kuantitas bintang hidup 93 yang menang di atas sana sebagaimana ia menang di bawah sini,
94 sebuah obor turun dari langit, 95 terbentuk dalam lingkaran seperti mahkota, 96 dan melingkari dan berputar di sekelilingnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Qualunque melodia più dolce suona 98 qua giù e più a sé l’anima tira, 99 parrebbe nube che squarciata tona,
100 comparata al sonar di quella lira 101 onde si coronava il bel zaffiro 102 del quale il ciel più chiaro s’inzaffira.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Any melody that sounds sweetest 98 down here and most draws the soul to itself, 99 would seem a cloud torn and thundering,
100 compared to the sound of that lyre 101 with which the beautiful sapphire was crowned, 102 with which the clearest heaven is adorned.
**Malay:**
97 Melodi apa pun yang berbunyi paling merdu 98 di sini dan paling menarik jiwa, 99 akan tampak seperti awan yang terkoyak dan bergemuruh,
100 dibandingkan dengan bunyi kecapi itu 101 yang dengannya safir yang indah itu dimahkotai, 102 yang dengannya langit yang paling cerah dihiasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Così la circulata melodia 110 si sigillava, e tutti li altri lumi 111 facean sonare il nome di Maria.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Thus the circling melody 110 was sealed, and all the other lights 111 made the name of Mary resound.
**Malay:**
109 Demikianlah melodi yang berputar-putar 110 dimeteraikan, dan semua cahaya lainnya 111 membuat nama Maria bergema.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Lo real manto di tutti i volumi 113 del mondo, che più ferve e più s’avviva 114 ne l’alito di Dio e nei costumi,
115 avea sopra di noi l’interna riva 116 tanto distante, che la sua parvenza, 117 là dov’ io era, ancor non appariva:
118 però non ebber li occhi miei potenza 119 di seguitar la coronata fiamma 120 che si levò appresso sua semenza.
query.result:
**English:**
112 The royal mantle of all the volumes 113 of the world, which most burns and most quickens 114 in the breath of God and in human conduct,
115 had its inner shore so far above us 116 that its appearance, where I was, 117 was not yet visible:
118 therefore my eyes had no power 119 to follow the crowned flame 120 that rose after its seed.
**Malay:**
112 Jubah agung dari semua jilid 113 di dunia, yang paling membara dan paling bersemangat 114 dalam nafas Tuhan dan dalam perilaku manusia,
115 memiliki pantai bagian dalam di atas kita 116 yang begitu jauh, sehingga penampakannya, 117 di tempat aku berada, masih belum terlihat:
118 oleh karena itu mataku tidak memiliki kekuatan 119 untuk mengikuti nyala api yang dimahkotai 120 yang muncul setelah benihnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Indi rimaser lì nel mio cospetto, 128 ‘Regina celi’ cantando sì dolce, 129 che mai da me non si partì ’l diletto.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Then she remained there before me, 128 singing ‘Regina celi’ so sweetly, 129 that the delight never left me.
**Malay:**
127 Kemudian dia tetap di sana di hadapanku, 128 menyanyikan ‘Regina celi’ dengan sangat merdu, 129 sehingga kesenangan itu tidak pernah meninggalkanku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Oh quanta è l’ubertà che si soffolce 131 in quelle arche ricchissime che fuoro 132 a seminar qua giù buone bobolce!
133 Quivi si vive e gode del tesoro 134 che s’acquistò piangendo ne lo essilio 135 di Babillòn, ove si lasciò l’oro.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Oh, how abundant is the bounty that is sown 131 in those most fertile fields that were 132 cultivated here below by good husbandmen!
133 Here one lives and enjoys the treasure 134 that was acquired with weeping in the exile 135 of Babylon, where gold was left behind.
**Malay:**
130 Oh, betapa melimpahnya hasil yang ditabur 131 di ladang-ladang yang sangat subur itu yang dulunya 132 diolah di sini di bawah oleh petani-petani yang baik!
133 Di sini orang hidup dan menikmati harta 134 yang diperoleh dengan menangis di pengasingan 135 Babilonia, tempat emas ditinggalkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Quivi trïunfa, sotto l’alto Filio 137 di Dio e di Maria, di sua vittoria, 138 e con l’antico e col novo concilio,
139 colui che tien le chiavi di tal gloria.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Here triumphs, under the high Son 137 of God and Mary, in his victory, 138 and with the old and the new council,
139 he who holds the keys to such glory.
**Malay:**
136 Di sini menang, di bawah Putra yang tinggi 137 Tuhan dan Maria, dalam kemenangannya, 138 dan dengan dewan yang lama dan yang baru,
139 dia yang memegang kunci-kunci kemuliaan tersebut.
